title: Minuscule 85
text:
Minuscule 85 (in the <a href="Biblical%20manuscript%23Gregory-Aland">Gregory-Aland</a> numbering), ε 391 (<a href="Biblical%20manuscript%23Von%20Soden">Soden</a>), is a <a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a> <a href="Lower%20case">minuscule</a> <a href="manuscript">manuscript</a> of the <a href="New%20Testament">New Testament</a>, on parchment leaves. <a href="Palaeography">Palaeographically</a> it has been assigned to the 13th century. It has <a href="marginalia">marginalia</a>.
Description.
The codex contains the text of the four <a href="Gospel">Gospel</a>s, with numerous lacunae, on 30 parchment leaves (size ), with numerous <a href="Lacuna%20%28manuscripts%29">lacunae</a>. The text is written in one column per page, 25 lines per page (size of text 10.1 by 6.2). The initial letters are written in red.
The text is divided according to the ("chapters"), whose numbers are given at the margin, and the ("titles of chapters") at the top of the pages. There is also a division according to the Ammonian Sections, (no references to the <a href="Eusebian%20Canons">Eusebian Canons</a>).
It contains lectionary markings at the margin (for liturgical use), and incipits.
Matthew 8:15-9:17; 16:12-17.20; 24:26-45; 26:35-54; Mark 6:13-9.45; Luke 3:12-6.44; John 9:11-12:5; 19:6-24; 20:23-21:9.
The Greek text of the codex <a href="Kurt%20Aland">Kurt Aland</a> did not place in any <a href="Categories%20of%20New%20Testament%20manuscripts">Category</a>. 
It was not examined by the <a href="Claremont%20Profile%20Method">Claremont Profile Method</a>.
History.
The manuscript used to be held in <a href="Augsburg">Augsburg</a> (as codices <a href="Minuscule%2083">83</a>, <a href="Minuscule%2084">84</a>).
It was examined by <a href="Johann%20Albrecht%20Bengel">Bengel</a> (as August. 3), <a href="Johann%20Martin%20Augustin%20Scholz">Scholz</a>, and <a href="Dean%20Burgon">Dean Burgon</a>. <a href="C.%20R.%20Gregory">C. R. Gregory</a> saw it in 1887.
It is housed in at the <a href="Bavarian%20State%20Library">Bavarian State Library</a> (Gr. 569), at <a href="M%C3%BCnchen">München</a>.
